symc.name: SM_CXSCREEN
symc.desc: The width of the screen of the primary display monitor, in pixels.

symc.name: SM_CYSCREEN
symc.desc: The height of the screen of the primary display monitor, in pixels.

symc.name: SM_CVXSCROLL
symc.desc: The width of a vertical scroll bar, in pixels

symc.name: SM_CYHSCROLL
symc.desc: The height of a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels

symc.name: SM_CYCAPTION
symc.desc: The height of a caption area, in pixels.

symc.name: SM_CYBORDER
symc.desc: The height of a window border, in pixels

symc.name: SM_CYFIXEDFRAME
symc.desc: The thickness of the frame around the perimeter of a window that has a caption but is not sizable, in pixels.

symc.name: SM_CYDLGFRAME
symc.desc: The thickness of the frame around the perimeter of a window that has a caption but is not sizable, in pixels.

symc.name: SM_CXICON
symc.desc: The default width of an icon, in pixels. The LoadIcon function can load only icons with the dimensions that SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON specifies.

symc.name: SM_CYICON
symc.desc: The default height of an icon, in pixels. The LoadIcon function can load only icons with the dimensions SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON.

symc.name: SM_CYVSCROLL
symc.desc: The height of the arrow bitmap on a vertical scroll bar, in pixels

symc.name: SM_CXFRAME
symc.desc: This value is the same as SM_CXSIZEFRAME.

symc.name: SM_DBCSENABLED
symc.desc: Nonzero if User32.dll supports DBCS; otherwise, 0

symc.name: SM_CXSMICON
symc.desc: The recommended width of a small icon, in pixels

symc.name: SM_CYSMICON
symc.desc: The recommended height of a small icon, in pixels

symc.name: SM_MIDEASTENABLED
symc.desc: Nonzero if the system is enabled for Hebrew and Arabic languages, 0 if not

symc.name: SM_XVIRTUALSCREEN
SM_SERVERR2
symc.desc: The build number if the system is Windows Server 2003 R2; otherwise, 0
The coordinates for the left side of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

symc.name: SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN
symc.desc: The coordinates for the top of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

symc.name: SM_CXVIRTUALSCREEN
symc.desc: The width of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

symc.name: SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN
symc.desc: The height of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

symc.name: SM_CMONITORS
symc.desc: The number of display monitors on a desktop.
